comment.text: Information is based on database description. Actual diagnose is missing

Bacterial infections Meningitis Patient presented rapidly increasing occipital headache, fever and arthralgia. At the admission patient was pyrexial, somnolent and confused. Patient had neck stiffness and abnormal Lase's and Babinski's signs on both sides. Patient's CSF was turbid.

consequence.term: point mutation in the exon 2 leading to a premature stop codon in the TSP TYPE-1 domain
point mutation in the exon 4 leading to a premature stop codon of pedigree:Patient's sister (II-1) has

comment.text: Information is based on database description. Actual diagnose is missing

emerged at the age of 28 Other clinical features: 28-year old (2001) Japanese woman had been generally well and physically active all her life until she presented with a 1-month history of progressive muscle weakness. She had a 3-year history of facial erythema and examination revealed a light purplish erythematous area on the patient's cheeks extending to involve the upper eyelids. Proximal muscle weakness was evident. She had difficulty in raising her arms above her head.

consequence.term: point mutation in the exon 4 leading to a premature stop codon in the LDL-RECEPTOR CLASS A domain
